sen.j: 法華経への信仰が厚く、持経者である。
sen.e: He had deep faith in a sutra Hokekyo and an upholder of the Sutra.
He had deep faith in Hokke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra) and was an upholder of the Sutra.

sen.j: 両親の菩提を祈り(祈親)、法華経を読誦し、常に経を持っていたという(持経)。
sen.e: It is said that he prayed to Buddha for the happiness for the dead parents, which is called 'Kishin', always recited the sutra Hokekyo, and he always carried the sutra, which is called Jikyo.

sen.j: 亡くなった両親の所在を知るため大和長谷寺を訪れ、観音像より霊告を受けて高野山に登る。
sen.e: He visited Hasedera Temple in Yamato to find out whereabouts of his dead parents' body, and received a message from the statue of Goddess of Mercy to go up Mt. Koya.

sen.e: Those days, Mt. Koya was devastated by conflicts with Toji Temple, fire caused by thunderbolt, and the like.

sen.e: Jyoyo worked for restoring Mt. Koya, living in the mountain by using his own means for protecting against the cold.

sen.e: In the inner sanctuary of Mt. Koya, there has been a light offered to Buddha called 'Kishinto' or also known as 'Hinjo no itto' that have never been gone out and said to have been offered by Joyo.
